### Phrasing patterns and examples

## **Vocab and Style Preferences**

This section defines the functional language standards that ensure consistency across all payabl. content. It covers naming conventions, punctuation, grammar, and usage.

### **1. Product naming conventions**

All product names follow a **consistent, descriptive format** that reflects payabl.â€™s commitment to clarity and simplicity. Each name communicates what the product is or does, without jargon or abstraction.

### **Format:**

**payabl.** + **descriptor** (functional noun or noun phrase, lowercase)

| Example | Refers to |
| --- | --- |
| **payabl. checkout** | Online payment gateway (acquiring) |
| **payabl. in-store** | Point-of-sale (POS) payments |
| **payabl. business accounts** | Business banking functionality |
| **payabl. virtual business cards** | Corporate expense cards |
| **payabl. card manager** | Interface for managing virtual cards |
| **payabl. crypto** | Crypto payment and settlement tools |
| **payabl.one** | Unified platform across all services |

### **Sub-features format:**

Use the structure **"[feature] by payabl."** for sub-products under broader categories.

E.g.:

- *Stablecoin settlements by payabl.*
- *Acquiring by payabl.*

> Always retain the dot in payabl. â€” it is part of the brand, not optional.
> 

### **2. Capitalisation and Formatting Rules**

- Use **sentence case** for all UI elements, buttons, CTAs, and headlines.
    
    E.g. â€œView transactionsâ€, not â€œView Transactionsâ€
    
- **Never use camelCase** **or PascalCase** for product names.
    
    âœ… *payabl.one*
    
    âŒ *payablOne*, *PayablOne*
    

### **3. Use of abbreviations**

Use abbreviations only when they are widely recognised and functionally necessary. Do not introduce unexplained or internal acronyms.

| Approved abbreviations | Use notes |
| --- | --- |
| API | Application Programming Interface |
| POS | Point-of-sale (contextual, not branded) |
| CSV | File format reference |
| SEPA | Single Euro Payments Area |
| SDK | Software Development Kit |
| AMEX | American Express |

> Avoid inventing new acronyms or abbreviating product names. Never abbreviate payabl. checkout, payabl. crypto, etc.
> 

### **4. Pluralisation Rules**

- Use **plural terms** when referring to categories, collections, or general functionality.
    
    âœ… *virtual business cards*, *payments*, *disputes*
    
- Use **singular** only for individual items or actions.
    
    âœ… *Make a payment*, *freeze a card*
    

> "payment" vs. "payments"
> 
> - Use **payment** for a single transaction
> - Use **payments** when referring to the industry, a system, or multiple transactions

**Correct examples:**

- "Our platform supports various payments solutions."
- "Please confirm that the payment was received."
- "2025 commerce and payments trends report"

## **Writing Style**
